sentence.text: She backed two steps from him , then turned and ran towards the building .
` No ! " she cried on a sudden note of panic , and backed a step from him .
He backed across the room keeping pieces of furniture between himself and the three of us .
She backed hurriedly from the chamber and along the passageway .
Rachel backed from it , shaking .
Gerard bowed and backed from the room .
She backed in a gentle arc to face the open sea , and as Neil gunned the engine she jumped forward and then settled to a smooth , fast pace .
I finally managed to push the huge animal away and backed into a corner for safety .
Dr Williams was backing into a corner and just brushed his glasses away .
Without conscious volition , she backed into her office and stood behind the door .
Culliman chuckled at the idea ; the Ambassador murmured something and backed into the room .
Willie blushed and backed into the sack .
The other man backed into the shadows of the doorway .
Her gaze fixed on her adversary , she had backed straight into what felt rather like a human version of the Great Wall of China .
He backed onto the pavement .
There you are , Curtis , " Delia Sutherland said as he backed through the door with a tray .
As if they were doing a bizarre dance , followed by Marx , Herr Nordern backed through the tiny vestibule , into the sitting-room , and a silent , apprehensive circle of Norderns .
Delia Sutherland , having given Kennedy 's hand a cursory grip , backed to the fireplace , heels on the fender , gaining two inches .
She flung the receiver away from her as though it were rotten , and backed toward the door .
She backed gently towards the door .
Lord John , as white faced as any of the fashionable women at the ball , backed uncertainly towards his friends who hurried towards the confrontation .
I backed rapidly up the stairs , holding the bouquet between us like Peter Cushing used to hold a crucifix up to Dracula .
His owner immediately backed out of harm 's way .

They could not forget that the American government had already backed away from some of its more liberal inclinations on postwar world economic development in the face of various domestic pressure groups .
He was hit in the legs , but he backed out of the line of fire .
The end was curt and unpleasant : Mario not only lost his FI deal but also backed out of racing for Parnelli in America .
He backed away , looked at Evelyn .
But he just shook his head and backed away , and repeated over and over again , ` Stay away .
Peter backed down the hall and into the kitchen .
He backed away towards the nook beside the elevator , where he kept his gun , but the stranger was too quick .
He backed away to the other side of the room .
She did n't like it , but she could n't back away without making it very obvious that her nerve-ends were definitely reacting to his closeness .
If she backed away into the kitchen then she would never get rid of Shirley and tonight she had promised to cook dinner for Glyn .
Robert backed away towards his chair , trying to work out whether this was the deception to which the headmaster was referring .
The fellow backed off into the centre of the room .
So saying he backed out into the corridor again , where Shiona caught a glimpse of the frowning faces of a couple of uniformed railway officials .
She twisted away from him and backed over to the door , and then cracked it open , and peered out into the hall .
Jehan took the tray of cakes out of her hands , and then he grinned ferociously at her so that she backed hastily away .
The car braked suddenly with screeching wheels , then backed rapidly until it was level with me .
Then he covered his face with his small , fluttery hands and backed shyly away .
Her hand recoiled from the wooden panel as if it were red-hot , and she backed silently away .
